function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Machine learning approaches applied to wearable data could tease out signals of infection or disease states.","Impact":"Failure to detect infections or disease states early could lead to the rapid spread of contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Continuous monitoring and validation of machine learning predictions using multiple sources of data.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms, wearable sensors, data fusion techniques.","People":"Public and occupants of built environments.","Owner":"Public health agencies, building management authorities."},{"Description":"Users might not have the time or inclination to continually provide updated information from wearables and self-reported symptoms.","Impact":"Incomplete or inconsistent data inputs may reduce the accuracy of infection prediction models, leading to potential false negatives.","Mitigation":"Automated data collection from wearables, incentivizing user participation in data reporting.","Technologies":"Wearable devices with continuous data collection capabilities, user-friendly data reporting interfaces.","People":"Wearable device users.","Owner":"Wearable device manufacturers, healthcare providers."}]}
